discussion.p: polymorphic_allocator can trivially support the allocator completeness requirements () just as does the default allocator. Doing so imposes no implementation burden, and enables pmr::forward_list, pmr::list, and pmr::vector to support incomplete types as do the non-pmr equivalents.
discussion.note: 2018-01; Priority set to 2 after mailing list discussion

li.p: Add a new paragraph in after para 1:

blockquote.p: 1 A specialization of class template pmr::polymorphic_allocator conforms to the Allocator requirements [...]
